Chinese Simplified (CN): 假定六轩岛上，除去右代宫家的房屋以外，还存在着秘密的宅邸，里面住着名叫贝阿朵莉切的女性。

Umineko Project (UP): In order to prove this, one must find this mansion and actually bring {f:5:Beatrice} out of it.
Steam (ST): In order to prove this, one must find this mansion and actually bring {f:5:Beatrice} out of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In order to prove this, one must find this mansion and actually bring Beatrice out of it.
PC Japanese (JP): これを実証するには、その屋敷を見つけ、ベアトリーチェを実際に連れて来なければならない。
Russian (RU): Чтобы это доказать, нужно найти этот особняк и вытащить оттуда {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para provar isso, é preciso encontrar essa mansão e trazer essa {f:5:Beatrice} para fora dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要證實這個假說，必須找到秘密宅邸，並實際帶來貝阿朵莉切本人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要证实这个假说，必须找到秘密宅邸，并实际带来贝阿朵莉切本人。

Umineko Project (UP): That's called actual proof in the human world.
Steam (ST): That's called actual proof in the human world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's called actual proof in the human world.
PC Japanese (JP): それが人の世での実証だ。
Russian (RU): Это считается полноценным доказательством в мире людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso é chamado de prova no mundo humano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這就是人世間的實證。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这就是人世间的实证。

Umineko Project (UP): However, if we follow the rules of the "Devil's Proof", you can't disprove that she exists, even if there's no evidence that she does.
Steam (ST): However, if we follow the rules of the "Devil's Proof", you can't deny that she exists, even if there's no proof that she does.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, if we follow the rules of the 'Devil's Proof', you can't deny that she exists, even if there's no proof that she does.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、“悪魔の証明”に則るならば、例え何の証拠もなくとも、彼女の存在を否定できない。
Russian (RU): Однако если мы последуем правилам "Доказательства дьявола", нельзя отрицать, что она существует, даже если тому нет никаких доказательств.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No entanto, se seguirmos as regras da "Prova Diabólica", você não pode refutar que ela existe, mesmo se não houver nenhuma evidência em relação a ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，如果遵循“惡魔的證明”，即便沒有任何她存在的證據，也無法否定她的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，如果遵循“恶魔的证明”，即便没有任何她存在的证据，也无法否定她的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): Because it's impossible to prove that something doesn't exist.
Steam (ST): Because it's impossible to prove that something doesn't exist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because it's impossible to prove that something doesn't exist.
PC Japanese (JP): 存在しないことは証明不能だからだ。
Russian (RU): Ведь невозможно доказать, что чего‐то не существует.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque é impossível provar que algo não existe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為，要證明不存在是不可能的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为，要证明不存在是不可能的。

Umineko Project (UP): ......That's right, this "Devil's Proof", which tormented me so much before, I've finally managed to use to my own advantage.
Steam (ST): ...That's right, I'm finally able to turn the tables using this "Devil's Proof", which tormented me so much before.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That's right, I'm finally able to turn the tables using this 'Devil's Proof', which tormented me so much before.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そう、これまでに、さんざん苛まれてきた“悪魔の証明”を逆手に取ったことになる。
Russian (RU): ...Верно, я наконец‐то смог развернуть ситуацию в свою пользу, воспользовавшись "Доказательством дьявола", так мучившим меня раньше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Isso mesmo, com essa "Prova Diabólica", que muito me atormentou antes, agora eu posso finalmente usá‐la como uma vantagem para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對，之前一直折磨著我的“惡魔的證明”反而被我抓住了把柄。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对，之前一直折磨着我的“恶魔的证明”反而被我抓住了把柄。

Umineko Project (UP): Those guys were always trying to force me to accept the existence of the witch by using the "Devil's Proof".
Steam (ST): Those guys were always trying to force me to accept the existence of the witch with it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those guys were always trying to force me to accept the existence of the witch by using the 'Devil's Proof'.
PC Japanese (JP): ヤツらは常に“悪魔の証明”で魔女の存在を無理やり認めさせようとしてきた。
Russian (RU): Меня всё время пытались вынудить принять существование ведьм, используя "Доказательство дьявола".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles estão sempre me forçando a aceitar a existência de uma bruxa usando essa "Prova Diabólica".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那幫傢伙總是在以“惡魔的證明”強迫我承認魔女的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那帮家伙总是在以“恶魔的证明”强迫我承认魔女的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): That was because, in response to Beato's professions that witches do exist, I physically could not offer any proof that "witches don't exist".
Steam (ST): After all, it was physically impossible for me to show any proof that "witches don't exist" and deny Beato's claims.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was because, with regards to the self-styled witch, Beato, I couldn't offer physical proof that 'witches don't exist'.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女はいると自称するベアトに対し、俺は“魔女はいない”という証拠を示すことが物理的にできない。
Russian (RU): Так было потому, что в отношение этой самозваной ведьмы Беато, я не мог предоставить физического доказательства того, что "ведьм не существует".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso porque, em resposta à solene declaração da Beato de que bruxas existem, eu fisicamente não poderia oferecer nenhuma prova além de dizer que "bruxas não existem".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對於自稱魔女存在的貝阿朵，從物理法則上講，我是無法拿出“沒有魔女”的證據的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对于自称魔女存在的贝阿朵，从物理法则上讲，我是无法拿出“没有魔女”的证据的。

Umineko Project (UP): That is why I have been subjected to this nonsense that witches exist, and why I have been unable to counterattack.
Steam (ST): That's why I kept getting hit with the reckless argument that witches do exist...and was unable to counterattack.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I kept getting hit with the reckless argument that this meant witches do exist, and was unable to counterattack.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこそ、魔女は存在するという暴論を反撃不能で突き付けられてきた。
Russian (RU): Я постоянно получал удары безрассудной аргументацией, согласно которой ведьмы существовали, и был не в силах контратаковать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, venho sendo sujeitado a esse absurdo de que bruxas existem, e continuo incapaz de contra‐atacar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正因如此，才陷入了無法反擊聲稱魔女存在的謬論的困境。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正因如此，才陷入了无法反击声称魔女存在的谬论的困境。

Umineko Project (UP): And that's why I'll flip over the chessboard right now!
Steam (ST): And that's why I'll spin the chessboard around right now!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And that's why I'll turn the chessboard over right now!
PC Japanese (JP): だからここでチェス盤を引っ繰り返す！
Russian (RU): Вот почему сейчас я разворачиваю шахматную доску!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E por isso que eu vou virar esse tabuleiro de xadrez agora mesmo!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，就在此把國際象棋盤翻轉過來！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，就在此把国际象棋盘翻转过来！

Umineko Project (UP): If I can't disprove that witches exist, then that means, if I suggest that a 19th human exists, you can't disprove that either.
Steam (ST): If I can't disprove the existence of witches, then that means... if I suggest that a 19th human exists, you can't deny that either.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If I can't disprove that witches exist, then that means, if I suggest that a 19th human exists, you can't deny that either.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女が存在することを否定できないならば、それはつまり、１９人目の人間が存在すると俺が言い出しても、それもまた否定できないわけだ。
Russian (RU): Раз я не могу опровергнуть того, что ведьмы существуют, то тогда, если я предположу, что 19‐й человек существует, вы этого тоже отрицать не сможете.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se eu não posso contestar que bruxas existem, então isso significa que, se eu sugerir que um 19º humano existe, você também não pode refutar isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 既然無法否定魔女的存在，那也就代表著，我所提出的第十九人的存在，也是完全無法否定的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 既然无法否定魔女的存在，那也就代表着，我所提出的第十九人的存在，也是完全无法否定的。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, the enigmatic mistress in question is craftily hiding herself, so it's perfectly natural that you can never find her no matter how hard you look.
Steam (ST): In other words, because this problematic and mysterious mistress is craftily hiding herself, it'd be perfectly natural if you never found her no matter how hard you looked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, because this problematic and mysterious mistress is craftily hiding herself, it would be perfectly natural if you never find her no matter how hard you look.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、問題の謎の愛人は狡猾に隠れているわけだから、どんなに探しても見付からないのは当然。
Russian (RU): Другими словами, из‐за того, что эта проблематичная и таинственная любовница умело скрывается, совершенно естественно, что вы никогда её не найдёте, как бы ни искали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, a enigmática amante em questão está escondendo a si mesma de forma astuta, por isso é perfeitamente natural que você nunca a encontre, não importando o quanto procure.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，正是因為成問題的謎之情婦狡猾地藏了起來，所以當然怎麼找都找不到。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，正是因为成问题的谜之情妇狡猾地藏了起来，所以当然怎么找都找不到。

Umineko Project (UP): So you can't say that "The 19th person can't be found = The 19th person doesn't exist".
Steam (ST): So, you can't say that your inability to find this 19th person proves that she doesn't exist.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So you can't say that the 19th person can't be found, and that therefore, the 19th person doesn't exist.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、１９人目が見付からないこと＝１９人目はいない、とはならないわけだ。
Russian (RU): Так что вы не можете заявить, что 19‐го человека не найти, а значит, его не существует.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, você não pode dizer que "A 19ª pessoa não pode ser encontrada = a 19ª pessoa não existe".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，“沒有找到第十九人＝沒有第十九人”的等式並不成立。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，“没有找到第十九人＝没有第十九人”的等式并不成立。

Umineko Project (UP): Therefore, it is impossible to disprove a 19th person.{n}Beato used the "Devil's Proof" to make denying her existence impossible, but this time it's become my weapon.
Steam (ST): Therefore, it's impossible to deny the 19th person's existence. Beato used the "Devil's Proof" to make denying her own existence impossible, but this time it's become my weapon.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's because it's impossible to deny the 19th person's existence. Beato used the 'Devil's Proof' to make denying her existence impossible, but this time it's become my weapon.
PC Japanese (JP): ゆえに、１９人目の否定は不可能。ベアトが自らの存在を否定不能とした“悪魔の証明”が、今度はそのまま俺の武器になったわけだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ゆえに、１９人目の否定は不可能。{n}ベアトが自らの存在を否定不能とした“悪魔の証明”が、今度はそのまま俺の武器になったわけだ。
Russian (RU): Поскольку невозможно отрицать существование 19‐го человека.{n}Беато воспользовалась "Доказательством дьявола", чтобы сделать невозможным отрицание её существования, но на этот раз оно стало моим оружием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Portanto, é impossível refutar a existência de uma 19ª pessoa.{n}Beato usou a "Prova Diabólica" tornando impossível negar sua existência, mas dessa vez isso virou minha arma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，要否定第十九人是不可能的。{n}貝阿朵用來使自己的存在變得無法否定的“惡魔的證明”，這次完全成了我的武器。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，要否定第十九人是不可能的。{n}贝阿朵用来使自己的存在变得无法否定的“恶魔的证明”，这次完全成了我的武器。

Umineko Project (UP): If we can get away with this argument, then never mind a 19th person, this island could be full of people we don't know about, and even if there are ten or a hundred of them hiding, she still can't disprove that they exist.
Steam (ST): If we can get away with this argument, then forget just a 19th person, this island could be full of people we don't know about, and even if there were 10 or 100 of them, she still couldn't deny that they existed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If we can get away with this argument, then forget just a 19th person, this island could be full of people we don't know about, and even if there were 10 or 100 of them, she still couldn't deny that they existed.
PC Japanese (JP): この論法が罷り通るなら、１９人目どころか、島には俺らの与り知れない人間が、それこそ１０人、１００人隠れていたとしても、その存在を否定することはできない。
Russian (RU): Если данный аргумент прокатит, то куда там 19‐й человек, на этом острове может оказаться полно незнакомых нам людей, и будь их 10 или 100, она всё равно не сможет отрицать их существование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se pudermos usar esse argumento, então não importa se uma 19ª pessoa existe, essa ilha poderia ficar repleta de pessoas que não conhecemos, e mesmo se tiver dez ou até cem delas escondidas, ela ainda não pode negar que elas existem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將這邏輯貫徹到底的話，別提第十九人了，這個島上就算藏著我們所不知道的十人、百人，也照樣無法否定他們的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将这逻辑贯彻到底的话，别提第十九人了，这个岛上就算藏着我们所不知道的十人、百人，也照样无法否定他们的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): In the last game and the one before that, among the murder scenes that showed up, there were several that were extremely intricate and must have taken a lot of effort to set up.
Steam (ST): In the last game and the one before that, among the murder scenes that showed up, there were several that were extremely intricate and must've taken a lot of effort to set up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the last game and the one before that, among the murder scenes that showed up, there were several that were extremely intricate and must have taken a lot of effort to set up.
PC Japanese (JP): 前回、前々回のゲームで登場した殺害現場の中には、非常に手の掛かる凝った現場がいくつか登場する。
Russian (RU): В прошлой и позапрошлой играх среди продемонстрированных сцен убийств было несколько особо изощрённых и наверняка потребовавших много сил для подготовки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No último jogo, e também no anterior a ele, entre as cenas de assassinato que foram mostradas, há diversas que são extremamente intrigantes e devem ter requerido muito esforço para serem montadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在上兩盤遊戲登場過的凶殺現場中，出現了不少相當複雜的，精心布置過的現場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在上两盘游戏登场过的凶杀现场中，出现了不少相当复杂的，精心布置过的现场。

Umineko Project (UP): It's very difficult to imagine that a single culprit could have set all of those up.
Steam (ST): It's really hard to imagine a single culprit setting up all of those.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It's very difficult to imagine that a single culprit could have set all of those up.
PC Japanese (JP): それらは単独の犯人が構築したと考えようとすると、非常に困難になってしまう。
Russian (RU): Очень сложно представить, что один преступник смог все это устроить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É muito difícil imaginar que um único culpado possa ter feito tudo aquilo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以單獨犯獨自構築來想，這是十分困難的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以单独犯独自构筑来想，这是十分困难的。

Umineko Project (UP): However, if not just a 19th person, but ten or a hundred people were hidden somewhere, that wouldn't be any problem at all.
Steam (ST): However, if not just a 19th person, but 10 or 100 people were hidden somewhere, that wouldn't be any problem at all.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, if not just a 19th person, but 10 or 100 people were hidden somewhere, that wouldn't be any problem at all.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、１９人目どころか、１０人も１００人も隠れていたならまったく何の問題もない。
Russian (RU): Однако если это не только 19‐й человек, но спрятавшиеся где‐то 10 или 100 человек, то подобное не будет проблемой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas e se não for apenas uma 19ª pessoa, mas dez ou cem pessoas escondidas em algum lugar, isso não seria problema nenhum.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，要是有第十九人，又或者是十人、百人藏著，那就完全沒有問題了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，要是有第十九人，又或者是十人、百人藏着，那就完全没有问题了。

Umineko Project (UP): If they all split up the work, they could handle any job in a short period of time.
Steam (ST): If they all split up the work, they could handle any job in a short period of time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If they all split up the work, they could handle any job in a short period of time.
PC Japanese (JP): 全員で手分けして作業すれば、どんな作業も短時間にこなせてしまうだろう。
Russian (RU): Если все они разделят работу, то могут выполнить любую задачу в короткий срок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se todas dividirem o trabalho, elas poderiam dar conta de qualquer tarefa em muito pouco tempo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這麼多人分工合作的話，無論怎麼布置，都能在短時間內完成。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这么多人分工合作的话，无论怎么布置，都能在短时间内完成。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, doubts will naturally arise at whether a large group of people like that could sneak around the mansion without being noticed, but those are all settled by the "Devil's Proof".
Steam (ST): Of course, doubts will naturally arise as to whether a large group of people like that could sneak around the mansion without being noticed, but those are all settled by the "Devil's Proof".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, doubts will naturally arise at whether a large group of people like that could sneak around the mansion without being noticed, but those are all settled by the 'Devil's Proof'.
PC Japanese (JP): それだけの大勢の人間が、あの屋敷内に気配もなく潜んでいたのかという疑問は当然、出るだろうが、これも“悪魔の証明”で決着できる。
Russian (RU): И, разумеется, естественно взяться сомнениям, как такая большая группа людей может незамеченной шнырять по особняку, однако они уже улажены "Доказательством дьявола".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, naturalmente vão surgir dúvidas sobre se um grande grupo de pessoas como esse poderia se esgueirar pela mansão sem serem notados, mas todos eles estão definidos pela "Prova Diabólica".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所謂“這麼一大群人，能毫無動靜地躲在大屋裡嗎？”的疑問，也是當然會出現的，但這也可以用“惡魔的證明”來解決。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所谓“这么一大群人，能毫无动静地躲在大屋里吗？”的疑问，也是当然会出现的，但这也可以用“恶魔的证明”来解决。

Umineko Project (UP): Because not seeing or not noticing a hundred people inside the mansion does not disprove that they were there.
Steam (ST): You can't deny that even 100 people were there just because they weren't seen or noticed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): You can't deny that even 100 people were there just because they weren't seen or noticed.
PC Japanese (JP): 気配がなかった・姿を見なかった＝屋敷内に１００人いたことの否定、にはならないからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 気配がなかった姿を見なかった＝屋敷内に１００人いたことの否定、にはならないからだ。
Russian (RU): Нельзя отрицать наличия там сотни человек лишь потому, что они не были замечены.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque não ver nem notar cem pessoas dentro da mansão não pode negar que elas não estão lá.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): “沒有動靜、沒看到人＝大屋內沒有一百個人”的等式是不成立的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): “没有动静、没看到人＝大屋内没有一百个人”的等式是不成立的。

Umineko Project (UP): Even though I'm saying it myself, it's such a stupid argument that it makes me wanna throw up! However, it's because it's such a dirty‐as‐hell move that makes it the perfect one to use against a witch.
Steam (ST): Even though I'm saying it myself, it's such a stupid argument that it makes me wanna throw up! However, because it's such a dirty move, it's a perfect one to use against a witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though I'm saying it myself, it's such a stupid argument that it makes me wanna throw up! However, because it's such a dirty move, it's a perfect one to use against a witch.
PC Japanese (JP): 自ら口にしておきながら何て暴論だろうな、反吐が出るぜ！　だが、そんなド汚ぇ一手だからこそ、魔女への一手に相応しいんだ。
Russian (RU): Но хоть это и мои слова, данный аргумент настолько глуп, что меня аж тошнит! Однако этот приём именно в силу своей подлости идеально подходит для применения против ведьмы.

Umineko Project (UP): When such a relationship exists, we call the latter the contrapositive...
Steam (ST): When such a relationship exists, the latter is called the contrapositive...

Umineko Project (UP): When "if A then B" is true, then at the same time, "if not B then not A" is also true.

Разумеется, мне было бы грустно и сложно смириться, скажи ты красным, что преступником является один из восемнадцати. ......Кто бы им ни оказался, мне наверняка, как пить дать, будет тяжело на душе..."

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice}'s red was truly her secret weapon, her treasured blade. The things she spoke in red would become solidified as the truth, and no amount of evidence or counterarguments could change them.

PC Japanese (JP): この、虚偽と幻想で侵食された島で、たったひとつ信じることができるのが、ヤツが語る赤の情報だけなのだ。
Russian (RU): На этом полном лжи и иллюзий острове я могу доверять лишь информации, сказанной красным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesta ilha dominada por falsidades e ilusões, a única coisa na qual eu posso acreditar...são as informações que ela fala em vermelho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這被虛假與幻想侵蝕了的島上，唯一能相信的，就只有她講出的赤紅的情報。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这被虚假与幻想侵蚀了的岛上，唯一能相信的，就只有她讲出的赤红的情报。

Umineko Project (UP): It is my only way across the chasm of Hell. Just a single tightrope.
Steam (ST): It's my only way across the chasm of hell. Just a single tightrope.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was my only way across the chasm of hell. Just a single tightrope.
PC Japanese (JP): 落ちれば奈落という、崖と崖の間に見出す唯一の活路。たった一本の綱渡り。
Russian (RU): Красная правда была моим единственным путём над бездной ада. Одним единственным канатом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A minha única forma de atravessar o abismo deste Inferno. Uma única corda bamba.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在兩處絕壁間僅能找到一條活路，掉下去就是無底的地獄。只能冒險走這唯一的鋼絲。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在两处绝壁间仅能找到一条活路，掉下去就是无底的地狱。只能冒险走这唯一的钢丝。

Umineko Project (UP): Her merciless blood‐red blade is the only way I can survive.
Steam (ST): Her merciless blood-red blade is the only way I can survive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her merciless blood-red blade was the only way I could survive.
PC Japanese (JP): ヤツの慈悲無き真っ赤な刃こそが、唯一の生きる道なのだ。
Russian (RU): Её беспощадный кроваво‐красный клинок был моим единственным способом выжить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua implacável lâmina de intenso vermelho é a única forma de fazer com que eu sobreviva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她那無情的真紅之刃，正是唯一的生路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她那无情的真红之刃，正是唯一的生路。

Umineko Project (UP): ...This isn't just walking on a tightrope, it's literally like walking on the edge of a blade...
Steam (ST): ...This isn't just walking on a tightrope, it's like literally walking on the edge of a blade...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...This wasn't just walking on a tightrope, it was like literally walking on the edge of a blade...
PC Japanese (JP): …それは文字通り、綱渡りどころか、刃の上を歩くようなもの…。
Russian (RU): ...Но это было не простое хождение по канату, а в буквальном смысле хождение по лезвию бритвы...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Isto não é apenas caminhar sob a corda bamba, é literalmente andar sobre a lâmina de uma espada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …別提是走鋼絲了，簡直就如同走在刀刃之上…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …别提是走钢丝了，简直就如同走在刀刃之上…。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course I'm afraid. In terms of her contrapositive, my victory condition—the denial of the witch—meant that the culprit was a human.
Steam (ST): Of course I'm afraid. Because my victory condition is the denial of witches, then, to use her contrapositive logic, the culprit must be human.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course I was afraid. Because of her contrapositive, my victory condition, the denial of the witch, meant that the culprit was a human.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、俺は恐れている。俺の勝利条件である魔女否定は、ヤツの言う対偶では、＝犯人は人間、となる。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, мне было страшно. Поскольку при её противопоставлении моё условие победы — отрицание ведьмы, означало, что преступником был человек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro que estou com medo. Nos termos da contrapositiva dela, minha condição de vitória — a negação da bruxa — significa que o culpado é humano.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，我也在害怕。作為我勝利條件的否定魔女，根據她所謂的對偶，＝犯人是人類。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，我也在害怕。作为我胜利条件的否定魔女，根据她所谓的对偶，＝犯人是人类。

Umineko Project (UP): But I didn't want to search for the culprit amid the 18.
Steam (ST): But I didn't want to search for a culprit amid the 18.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But I didn't want to search for the culprit amid the 18.
PC Japanese (JP): でも俺は、１８人の中に犯人を求めたくない。
Russian (RU): Но мне не хотелось искать преступника среди 18.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas eu não quero ter que procurar pelo culpado em meio aos 18.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是我不希望在十八人中尋求犯人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是我不希望在十八人中寻求犯人。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Therefore, I held on to a weak point, since I had to deny the witch and the 18 at the same time. Since I had been unable to understand that last time, that was where she had hit me, leaving me tattered and defeated.
Steam (ST): ...That's what made me stick to a weak position, since I had to claim both that it couldn't be a witch and that it couldn't be one of the 18. Last time, I was unable to understand that, so that's where she hit me, leaving me tattered and defeated.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Therefore, I held on to a weak point, since I had to claim that it couldn't be a witch or one of the 18 at the same time. Since I had been unable to understand that last time, that was where she had hit me, leaving me tattered and defeated.
PC Japanese (JP): …だからこそ、魔女も１８人も同時に否定しなければならないという弱点を抱え、にもかかわらずそれを理解できず、そこを突かれて前回はボロボロに負けた。
Russian (RU): ...Поэтому я придерживался слабой позиции, поскольку вынужден был одновременно утверждать, что преступником не была ведьма или один из 18. Поскольку я в прошлом был не в состоянии понять это, она наносила удары в это уязвимое место, сокрушив и победив меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Portanto, eu a segurei em seu ponto fraco, desde que eu precise negar a bruxa e os 18 ao mesmo tempo. Como fui incapaz de entender isso da última vez, foi onde ela me atingiu, me deixando aos pedaços e derrotado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …正因如此，我才背負上了“必須同時否定掉魔女與十八人”的弱點，還不明所以地，在上一盤中被刺中此處，一敗塗地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …正因如此，我才背负上了“必须同时否定掉魔女与十八人”的弱点，还不明所以地，在上一盘中被刺中此处，一败涂地。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But that's alright.{n}Let her hit me. Let her attack. No problem...
Steam (ST): ...But that's okay. Let her hit me. Let her attack. No problem...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But that's alright. Let her hit me. Let her attack. No problem...
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、それでいい。突かせろ。攻めさせろ。上等だ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……しかし、それでいい。{n}突かせろ。攻めさせろ。上等だ…。
Russian (RU): ......Но всё путём.{n}Пусть бьёт. Пусть нападает. Нет проблем...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas está tudo bem.{n}Deixe que ela me atinja. Deixe‐a atacar. Sem problema...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，這正好。{n}讓她刺。讓她攻。好極了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，这正好。{n}让她刺。让她攻。好极了…。

Umineko Project (UP): Someone said it once in an old sword‐fighting movie.{n}That "a good fortress has one, and only one, intentionally weak point".
Steam (ST): Someone said it once in an old sword-fighting movie. That "A good fortress has one, and only one, intentionally weak point".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Someone said it once in an old sword-fighting movie. That 'A good fortress has one, and only one, intentionally weak point'.
PC Japanese (JP): 古いチャンバラ映画で誰かが言ってたぜ。「良い城には一箇所だけ、わざと弱い部分がある」ってな。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 古いチャンバラ映画で誰かが言ってたぜ。{n}「良い城には一箇所だけ、わざと弱い部分がある」ってな。
Russian (RU): Кто‐то однажды сказал в старом фильме о фехтовании на мечах:{n}"У хорошей крепости есть одно и только одно намеренно слабое место".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Alguém disse isso uma vez em uma filme de luta de espadas.{n}Que "uma boa fortaleza tem um, e apenas um, ponto fraco intencional".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在一部有年頭的古裝武打片裡，有個人說過。{n}「好的城池，必會故意留一薄弱之處」。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在一部有年头的古装武打片里，有个人说过。{n}「好的城池，必会故意留一薄弱之处」。

Umineko Project (UP): The enemy would gather there. They would be lured there.{n}And that would be where the actual battle took place.
Steam (ST): The enemy would gather there. They would be lured there. And that would be where the actual battle took place.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The enemy would gather there. They would be lured there. And that would be where the actual battle took place.
PC Japanese (JP): 敵はそこに群がる。誘き出される。そしてそこが決戦場となる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 敵はそこに群がる。誘き出される。{n}そしてそこが決戦場となる。
Russian (RU): Враг соберётся там. Окажется заманен туда.{n}Там и произойдёт настоящий бой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O inimigo deve se reunir lá. Ele deve ser enganado lá.{n}Lá é onde a verdadeira batalha vai ocorrer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 敵人將被誘出。在此匯集。{n}然後，此地將成為兩軍決戰場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 敌人将被诱出。在此汇集。{n}然后，此地将成为两军决战场。

Umineko Project (UP): ...As long as I understand my weak points, and as long as she wants to attack those weak points, ......it's as if I've induced her to attack there...
Steam (ST): ...As long as I understood my weak points, and as long as she wanted to attack those weak points, ...it was as if I were luring her into launching an attack there...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...As long as I understood my weak points, and as long as that bitch wanted to attack those weak points, ......it was as if I were inducing her to attack there...
PC Japanese (JP): …俺が弱点を理解し、ヤツが俺のこの弱点を攻めたいと思う限り、……それはつまり、そう攻めるよう俺が誘導したのと同じことなんだ…。
Russian (RU): ...Пока я понимал свои слабые места, и пока эта гнида хотела наносить удар по ним... Я словно побуждал её нападать туда...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Contanto que eu entenda meus pontos fracos, e desde que ela queira me atacar nesses pontos fracos, ......é como se eu tivesse induzido ela a atacar esse ponto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …我已理解自己的弱點，只要那傢伙還盤算著進攻我的弱點，……那就等同於，在被我誘導著這麼進攻…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …我已理解自己的弱点，只要那家伙还盘算着进攻我的弱点，……那就等同于，在被我诱导着这么进攻…。

Umineko Project (UP): Carefully judge the distance from your enemy, ...and retreat step by step. Make them draw their sword first.
Steam (ST): Gauge the distance between us with care, ...retreating step by step. Make them move forward.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Consider that weakness with care, ...and retreat step by step. Make them move forward.
PC Japanese (JP): 間合いを慎重に計りながら、…じりじりと後退するんだ。向こうに先に抜かせるんだ。
Russian (RU): Внимательно относись к этой слабости... И отступай, шаг за шагом. Вынуди их продвигаться вперёд.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Julgando cuidadosamente a distância de seu inimigo, ...e recuando passo a passo. Faça‐o sacar sua espada primeiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 慎重地計算距離，…逐步後退。讓對方去搶先。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 慎重地计算距离，…逐步后退。让对方去抢先。

Umineko Project (UP): The more she recklessly flourishes that red, the more chances I'll have to strike back.
Steam (ST): The more she recklessly flourished that red, the more chances I would get to strike back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The more she recklessly flourished that red, the more chances I would get to strike back.
PC Japanese (JP): ヤツが闇雲に赤を振り回せば振り回すほど、俺に反撃のチャンスは増える。
Russian (RU): Чем больше она безрассудно пользуется красным, тем больше шансов для атаки я получу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quanto mais ela floresce aquele vermelho de forma descuidada, maiores são as chances de eu atacar de volta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她那傢伙越是胡亂濫用紅字，就越會增加我反擊的機會。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她那家伙越是胡乱滥用红字，就越会增加我反击的机会。

Umineko Project (UP): Don't be afraid of the red.{n}Keep the pressure on, so that she is forced to refute with the red......!
Steam (ST): Don't be afraid of the red. Keep her cornered, so that she'll have no choice but to refute me with the red...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Don't be afraid of the red. Keep her cornered, so that she won't be able to refute me with the red......!
PC Japanese (JP): 赤に怯えるな。むしろ、赤で反論せざるを得ないよう、追い詰めろ……！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 赤に怯えるな。{n}むしろ、赤で反論せざるを得ないよう、追い詰めろ……！
Russian (RU): Не надо бояться красного.{n}Продолжай загонять её в угол, чтобы она не могла отразить меня красным!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não tema o vermelho.{n}Continue a pressionar, para que ela seja forçada a refutar usando o vermelho......!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不要去畏懼紅字。{n}反過來去逼迫她，讓她不得不用紅字進行反駁……！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不要去畏惧红字。{n}反过来去逼迫她，让她不得不用红字进行反驳……！

Umineko Project (UP): No matter how oppressively she speaks in red, ......yes, that red itself is the same as fresh blood spurting from her wounds.
Steam (ST): No matter how oppressively she speaks in red, ...that's right, that red itself is the same as fresh blood leaking from her wounds.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how oppressively she speaks in red, ......that's right, that red itself is the same as fresh blood leaking from her wound.
PC Japanese (JP): ヤツがどんなに高圧に赤を語ろうとも、……そう、その赤こそは、ヤツの傷口より噴出す血潮も同じなのだ。
Russian (RU): Какими бы подавляющими ни были её сказанные красным слова... Точно, эта красная правда сама по себе подобна свежей крови, вытекающей из её раны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa o quão opressivamente ela fale usando o vermelho.{n}......Sim, o vermelho em si é o mesmo que o sangue fresco que está jorrando de suas feridas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不用管她怎樣講出紅字施加高壓，……對，這紅字，正是從她的傷口噴出的鮮血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不用管她怎样讲出红字施加高压，……对，这红字，正是从她的伤口喷出的鲜血。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Come on. ...What's wrong? ......First of all, why don't you tell me in red how many people are on this island total? If you don't, your raven can't cut me up......!"
Steam (ST): "So, ...what's wrong? ...First of all, why don't you tell me how many people are on this island total? If you don't, your raven can't cut me up...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So. ...What's wrong? ......First of all, why don't you tell me how many people are on this island total? If you don't, your raven can't cut me up......!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁ。…どうしたよ。……まずはこの島に合計で何人いるのか、赤で語ってもらおうじゃねぇか。さもないと、お前のカラスは俺に斬り込めないぜ……！」
Russian (RU): "Итак. ...В чём дело? ......Почему бы тебе для начала не сказать мне, сколько всего людей на этом острове? Не скажешь — и твой ворон не сможет меня рассечь!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos. ...Qual o problema? ......Primeiro de tudo, por que você não me diz em vermelho quantas pessoas tem ao total nessa ilha? Se não fizer isso, seu corvo não vai poder me cortar......!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「來呀。…怎麼啦。……不是先得以紅字講講，這個島上總共有幾人嗎？不然的話，你的烏鴉是砍不到我的……！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「来呀。…怎么啦。……不是先得以红字讲讲，这个岛上总共有几人吗？不然的话，你的乌鸦是砍不到我的……！」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): ".....................Hmph. ...How surprising that you can be this desperate and yet this difficult. ...One cannot make light of someone putting their life on the line, no matter what the era."
Steam (ST): ".........Hmph. ...How surprising that you can be this desperate and yet this difficult. ...One cannot make light of someone putting their life on the line, no matter what the era.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "..................Hmph. ...How surprising that you can be this desperate and yet this difficult. ...One cannot make light of someone putting their life on the line, no matter what the era.
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………………ふ。…破れかぶれが、こうもやり難いとは。…捨て身というヤツは、いつの時代も侮れんな。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………………ふ。…破れかぶれが、こうもやり難いとは。…捨て身というヤツは、いつの時代も侮れんな」
Russian (RU): "..................Хмф. ...Просто удивительно, как ты можешь находиться в таком отчаянном положении и в то же время быть таким сложным. ...Не стоит недооценивать ставящих на кон свою жизнь людей, какая бы эра ни была на дворе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".....................Hmph. ...É surpreendente que você possa estar tão desesperado e, ainda assim, ser difícil assim. ...Não se pode menosprezar quando alguém coloca sua vida na linha de frente, não importando qual seja a era."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………………哼。…破罐子破摔，竟如此難對付。…所謂奮不顧身的傢伙，無論哪個時代都不可小瞧呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………………哼。…破罐子破摔，竟如此难对付。…所谓奋不顾身的家伙，无论哪个时代都不可小瞧呢。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "......It's no surprise you're Kinzo's grandchild. The more cornered you are, ............the bolder you become!"
Steam (ST): ...It's no surprise you're Kinzo's grandchild. The more cornered you are, ......the bolder you become!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's no surprise you're Kinzo's grandchild. The more cornered you are, ............the bolder you become!"
PC Japanese (JP): ……やはり金蔵の孫か。追い詰められれば追い詰められるほどに、…………不敵！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……やはり金蔵の孫か。追い詰められれば追い詰められるほどに、…………不敵！」
Russian (RU): "......Неудивительно, что ты внук Кинзо. Чем больше тебя загоняют в угол, тем смелее ты становишься!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Não é surpresa que você seja o neto de Kinzo. Quanto mais encurralado fica, ............mais forte você se torna!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……果然是金藏的孫子啊。越是被逼入死地，就越是，…………無畏！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……果然是金藏的孙子啊。越是被逼入死地，就越是，…………无畏！」

Steam (ST): "...Ihihihi..."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]

Steam (ST): Ronove cleared his throat.

Speaker: Ronove
Umineko Project (UP): "You appear to be at a standstill. That black tea I worked so hard to make is getting cold, Milady."
Steam (ST): "It appears to be a stalemate. That black tea I worked so hard to make is getting cold, Milady."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It appears to be a stalemate. That black tea I worked so hard to make is getting cold, Milady."
PC Japanese (JP): 「膠着しましたね。せっかくの紅茶も冷めてしまいますよ、お嬢様。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「膠着しましたね。せっかくの紅茶も冷めてしまいますよ、お嬢様」
Russian (RU): "Похоже, сложилась патовая ситуация. Чёрный чай, над которым я так долго трудился, остывает, миледи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você parece estar paralisada. O chá preto que eu tanto me dediquei para preparar está esfriando, ojou‐sama."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「陷入膠著了呢。上好的紅茶都快涼了啊，小姐。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Ronove, who was supposed to be her ally, roguishly rushed her next move.

Как бы там ни было, отныне все уловки, являвшиеся невозможными для восемнадцати человек, могут быть объяснены человеком Х, не входящим в число 18. ......Эта крупная фигура может отпереть все комнаты, названные тобою запертыми, поскольку у всех есть алиби!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Esse X é uma grande peça que me permite fazer o primeiro movimento! Afinal, a partir daqui, todos os truques com a base de "é impossível para qualquer um dos 18"...se tornam explicáveis com um humano X fora das 18 pessoas. ......Essa é uma grande peça que pode abrir qualquer quarto fechado dependendo se todos tiverem um álibi...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這個 X，不在頭一著攔住的話，就會成為相當大的大棋子哦？畢竟以後，所有以十八人中誰都做不到為根據的詭計，全都能以十八人以外的人類 X 做出解釋。……是打破所有全體都擁有不在場證明的密室的，大棋子…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这个 X，不在头一着拦住的话，就会成为相当大的大棋子哦？毕竟以后，所有以十八人中谁都做不到为根据的诡计，全都能以十八人以外的人类 X 做出解释。……是打破所有全体都拥有不在场证明的密室的，大棋子…！」

Umineko Project (UP): It was just like...a bishop in chess, which can cut a thin line through enemy forces as long as there's a slight gap.
Steam (ST): It was just like how a chess bishop can cut a thin line through enemy forces as long as there's a slight gap.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was just like how a chess bishop can cut a thin line through enemy forces as long as there's a slight gap.
PC Japanese (JP): それはさながら、敵陣にわずかの隙間があれば鋭く食い込める、チェスのビショップのようなもの。
Russian (RU): Сложилась ситуация подобная той, когда шахматный слон может прорезать тонкую линию через вражеские силы, пока имеется небольшой проём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso é como...um bispo no xadrez, que pode cortar uma pequena e fina linha através das forças inimigas a desde que tenha uma pequena abertura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它就像是，只要有微小的空隙，就會長驅直入殺入敵陣的、國際象棋中的主教。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它就像是，只要有微小的空隙，就会长驱直入杀入敌阵的、国际象棋中的主教。

Umineko Project (UP): It only exerts an effect over squares of the same color, but it has a great ability to control the board.
Steam (ST): It could only be effectively used on squares of the same color, but it was very good at controlling territory on the board.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It could only be effectively used on squares of the same color, but it had a great ability to control the board.
PC Japanese (JP): 同じ色のマスにしか効果を発揮しないが、その盤上の支配力は大きい。
Russian (RU): Он мог эффективно применяться на квадратах одного цвета, но ему была присуща замечательная способность контролировать доску.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isso apenas exerce efeito sobre os quadrados da mesma cor, mas é uma grande habilidade para se controlar o tabuleiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然僅能在同色的格子上發揮功效，但它在棋盤上擁有巨大的支配力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然仅能在同色的格子上发挥功效，但它在棋盘上拥有巨大的支配力。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): It looked like Beato also well understood her current plight.
Steam (ST): It looked like Beato also noticed her current plight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It looked like Beato also noticed her current plight.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトも、現在の窮状をよく理解しているようだった。
Russian (RU): Было видно, что Беато тоже заметила, в какое затруднительное положение попала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que a Beato também entendeu a sua condição atual.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看來貝阿朵也充分理解了此刻自己所處的窘境。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看来贝阿朵也充分理解了此刻自己所处的窘境。

Umineko Project (UP): She couldn't just let such an important piece go, especially this close to the beginning of the game...If she pulled out her red treasured sword, it wouldn't be that difficult to save that piece.
Steam (ST): She couldn't just let such an important piece go, especially this close to the beginning of the game... If she pulled out her red treasured sword, it wouldn't be that difficult to save herself from this.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She couldn't just let such an important piece go, especially this close to the beginning of the game... If she pulled out her red treasured sword, it wouldn't be that difficult to save her from this.
PC Japanese (JP): これほどの大駒を、これほどの序盤に見捨てられるわけもない…。赤き宝刀を抜けば、それを救うことは難しくないだろう。
Russian (RU): Она просто не могла позволить лишиться такой важной фигуры, особенно так близко к началу игры...Достань она свой дорогой красный меч, и ей не будет так уж трудно спастись от этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não pode simplesmente deixar que uma peça importante seja perdida, especialmente ainda estando no começo do jogo... Se ela puxar sua preciosa espada vermelha, não seria difícil salvar essa peça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她無法在一開局，就對此等大棋子視而不見…。拔出赤紅寶刀的話，就不難解圍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她无法在一开局，就对此等大棋子视而不见…。拔出赤红宝刀的话，就不难解围。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But Beato was completely aware that I was expecting it. She was afraid that a careless red truth might end up strangling her own neck...!
Steam (ST): ...But Beato was completely aware that I was expecting it. She was afraid that a careless red truth might end up strangling her own neck...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But Beato was completely aware that I was expecting it. She was afraid that a careless red truth might end up strangling her own neck...!
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかしベアトは、むしろ俺がそれを待ち受けていることも、充分に察している。迂闊な赤き真実が、自らの首を絞めることになるかもしれないと怯えている…！
Russian (RU): ......Но Беато чётко осознавала, что этого я и жду. Она боялась, что неосторожно использованная красная правда может превратиться в петлю на её собственной шее!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas a Beato está completamente ciente de que eu estou esperando por isso. Ela está com medo que uma verdade vermelha descuidada possa acabar enforcando seu próprio pescoço...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……可是貝阿朵已經充分察覺到了，我正等著她這麼做。她在害怕，不小心用出來的赤紅真實，會不會反而掐緊自己的脖子…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……可是贝阿朵已经充分察觉到了，我正等着她这么做。她在害怕，不小心用出来的赤红真实，会不会反而掐紧自己的脖子…！

Umineko Project (UP): Because, ...in the first place, a witch was something which should be {i:denied} in red.
Steam (ST): Because...in the first place, a witch is something that ought to be denied in red.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because, ...in the first place, a witch was something which should be denied in red.
PC Japanese (JP): なぜなら、…本来、魔女は赤で否定されべき存在だからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): なぜなら、…本来、魔女は赤で否定されるべき存在だからだ。
Russian (RU): Потому что... ведьма первым делом была тем, что должно отрицаться {i:красным}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque, ...em primeiro lugar, uma bruxa é algo que deveria ser {i:negada} em vermelho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要問為什麼的話，…那是因為，魔女本就是該被紅字否定的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要问为什么的话，…那是因为，魔女本就是该被红字否定的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): Believe. Don't doubt! Witches don't exist!{n}Something like that can't exist in this world.
Steam (ST): Believe. Don't doubt! Witches don't exist! Something like that couldn't exist in this world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Believe. Don't doubt! Witches don't exist! Something like that couldn't exist in this world.
PC Japanese (JP): 信じろ。疑うな！　魔女などいない！この世にそんなもの、存在するわけもない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 信じろ。疑うな！　魔女などいない！{n}この世にそんなもの、存在するわけもない。
Russian (RU): Верь. Не сомневайся! Ведьмы не существуют!{n}Нечто подобное не может существовать в этом мире.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Acredite. Não duvide! Bruxas não existem!{n}Algo assim não pode existir neste mundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 相信。不要懷疑！根本沒有魔女！{n}這個世上，根本就不存在那種玩意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 相信。不要怀疑！根本没有魔女！{n}这个世上，根本就不存在那种玩意。

Umineko Project (UP): They can only exist in the cracks in reality.
Steam (ST): They can only exist in the valleys between truths.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They could only exist in the valleys between truths.
PC Japanese (JP): それが存在できるのは、現実の狭間だけ。
Russian (RU): Они могут существовать лишь в углублениях между правдами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas podem existir apenas no vazio da realidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她們只能存在於現實的夾縫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她们只能存在于现实的夹缝。

Umineko Project (UP): ...They are a fragile existence, curled up in these cracks, frantically trying to protect themselves from the brutal winds of truth, and they can only barely exist like a mirage by surviving on falsehoods and fantasy.
Steam (ST): ...They have a fragile existence, curled up in these cracks, frantically trying to protect themselves from the brutal winds of truth, and they can only barely exist like a mirage by surviving on falsehoods and illusions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...They were a fragile existence, curled up in these cracks, frantically trying to protect themselves from the brutal winds of truth, and they could only barely exist like a mirage by surviving on falsehoods and illusions.
PC Japanese (JP): …その隙間にて、真実の暴風から必死に身を守って縮こまり、虚偽と幻想で食い繋いでいる時だけ、蜃気楼のように細々と存在できる脆弱な存在なのだ。
Russian (RU): ...Они были хрупкими сущностями, забившимися в эти трещины, лихорадочно пытавшимися защитить себя от жестоких ветров правды, и они едва могли существовать в качестве миража, выживая на лжи, вымысле и иллюзиях.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Elas são existências fracas, envoltas em suas rachaduras, freneticamente tentando protegerem a si mesmas dos brutais ventos da verdade, existindo de forma escassa, como uma miragem que sobrevive dependendo das falsidades e fantasias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …在這夾縫中，拚命地蜷起身子，躲避真實的暴風，是僅在以虛假與幻想為食糧時，才能如海市蜃樓般勉強存在的，脆弱的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …在这夹缝中，拼命地蜷起身子，躲避真实的暴风，是仅在以虚假与幻想为食粮时，才能如海市蜃楼般勉强存在的，脆弱的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): In other words, the red, which only witches can use, is the very reality by which they risk denying themselves.
Steam (ST): In other words, the red, which only witches can use, is the reality that might easily deny their very being.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was the truth by which witches couldn't help but deny themselves, using the red words which only they could use.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、魔女だけが使える赤は、自らを否定しかねない現実そのもの。
Russian (RU): Такова была правда, согласной которой ведьмы не могли иначе, кроме как отрицать себя, прибегая к красной правде, которую только они же и могли использовать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou seja, o vermelho, que apenas bruxas podem usar, é a pura realidade do risco de negar a si mesma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換言之，只有魔女能用的紅字，正是會將她自身否定掉的現實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换言之，只有魔女能用的红字，正是会将她自身否定掉的现实。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The more they brandish their red words...the more they begin to lose, bit by bit, that crack in reality inside which they can endure.
Steam (ST): ...The more they brandish their red words, ...the more they begin to lose bit by bit that crack in truth inside which they can endure.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The more they brandish their red words......the more they begin to lose bit by bit that crack in truth inside which they can endure.
PC Japanese (JP): ……赤を振りかざせば振りかざすほどに。魔女はわずかずつだが、自らの凌げる現実の隙間を失っていく。
Russian (RU): ......Чем больше они разбрасываются своими красными словами, ...тем больше они начинают потихоньку лишаться той трещины в правде, находясь в которой они могут выживать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quanto mais brandem são suas palavras vermelhas...mais elas começam a se perder, pouco a pouco, nesse vazio da realidade, na qual são incapazes de suportar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……越是用紅字大講特講。魔女就越會一點一點地失去自己所棲身的，現實的夾縫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……越是用红字大讲特讲。魔女就越会一点一点地失去自己所栖身的，现实的夹缝。

Umineko Project (UP): That is why they don't want, through the red, ......to carelessly lose that crack in reality which is based on fuzzy information, or in other words, fantasy.
Steam (ST): That's why they don't want to use red words and carelessly lose that crack in truth, which is based on fuzzy information... or illusions, in other words.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was why they didn't want to use the red words and carelessly lose that crack in truth which was based on fuzzy information, ......in other words, illusions.
PC Japanese (JP): だからこそ、あやふやな情報、……つまり、幻想の余地ある現実の隙間を、無用心に赤で失いたくないのだ。
Russian (RU): Вот почему они хотят прибегать к красным словам и неосторожно лишиться той трещины в правде, основанной на неясной информации... Другими словами — иллюзиях.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso que ela não quer, através do vermelho, ......descuidadamente, se perder nesse vazio em meio à realidade, que é baseada em informações distorcidas, em outras palavras, fantasias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正因如此，才不想讓含糊的情報，……也就是容有幻想餘地的現實的夾縫，被粗心大意用出來的紅字奪去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正因如此，才不想让含糊的情报，……也就是容有幻想余地的现实的夹缝，被粗心大意用出来的红字夺去。

Umineko Project (UP): Because they understand that they would be gradually cornering themselves.
Steam (ST): That's because they understand that they're gradually being cornered.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was because they understood that they were gradually being cornered.
PC Japanese (JP): それが徐々に自分を追い詰めていくと理解しているから。
Russian (RU): Потому что они понимали, что их постепенно загоняют в угол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque elas entendem que gradualmente vão começar a encurralar a si mesmas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為她清楚，這是在一步一步地置自己於死地。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为她清楚，这是在一步一步地置自己于死地。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, she would never admit it.
Steam (ST): Of course, that bastard will never admit it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, that bastard would never admit it.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、ヤツはそれを認めないだろう。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, эта зараза ни за что этого не признает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, ela nunca vai admitir isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當然，她是不會承認這點的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当然，她是不会承认这点的。

Umineko Project (UP): Because, if she did, it would be the same as admitting that she is something that can't exist in this world, like an imaginary number.
Steam (ST): Because, if she did, it'd be the same as admitting that she's something that can't exist in this world, like an imaginary number.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because, if she did, it would be the same as admitting that she was something that couldn't exist in this world, like an imaginary number.
PC Japanese (JP): それを認めれば、自分がこの世に存在してはならない虚数的存在であることを認めたも同然になってしまうのだから。
Russian (RU): Поскольку поступи она так, это будет равносильно признанию, что она является чем‐то, что не может существовать в этом мире, как воображаемая величина.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porque, se ela fizer isso, seria o mesmo que admitir que ela é algo que não poderia existir neste mundo, como um número imaginário.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為，承認了這點，就等於承認了，自己是不能在這個世界上存在的，虛數般的存在。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为，承认了这点，就等于承认了，自己是不能在这个世界上存在的，虚数般的存在。

Umineko Project (UP): Don't be afraid. Stay strong...!{n}She knows this deep down, and better than anyone.
Steam (ST): Don't be afraid. Stay strong...! I know that she's the one who's really been pierced to the bone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Don't be afraid. Stay strong...! I know that she is the one who has really been pierced to the bone.
PC Japanese (JP): 怯えるな。強気でいろ…！ヤツが一番骨身に染みてわかってるんだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 怯えるな。強気でいろ…！{n}ヤツが一番骨身に染みてわかってるんだ。
Russian (RU): Не бойся. Крепись!..{n}Я знаю, что это она на деле пронзена до костей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não tema. Permaneça forte...!{n}Ela conhece esse abismo melhor do que qualquer um.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不要膽怯。保持強硬…！{n}她那傢伙，自己最是刻骨銘心地明白。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不要胆怯。保持强硬…！{n}她那家伙，自己最是刻骨铭心地明白。

Umineko Project (UP): That her red treasured sword can't easily be used without considerable resolve...!
Steam (ST): After all, her red treasured sword can't be used without a lot of preparation...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because her red treasured sword couldn't easily be used without a lot of preparation...!
PC Japanese (JP): 赤き宝刀は、相当の覚悟がなければ容易には使えないのだということを…！
Russian (RU): Поскольку её дорогой красный меч не может с лёгкость применяться без серьёзных приготовлений!..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Algo que sua preciosa espada não pode perfurar facilmente sem uma considerável determinação...!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 赤紅寶刀，沒有相當大的覺悟，是不能輕易使用的…！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 赤红宝刀，没有相当大的觉悟，是不能轻易使用的…！

Umineko Project (UP): "...What's wrong. I'll say it again. ......Repetition requested!"
Steam (ST): "...What's wrong? I'll say it again. ...Repeat it!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...What's wrong. I'll say it again. ......Repeat it!
PC Japanese (JP): 「…どうしたよ。繰り返すぜ。……復唱要求！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…どうしたよ。繰り返すぜ。……復唱要求！」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...O que foi? Eu vou dizer mais uma vez. ......Repetição requisitada!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "‘There are at least 19 people on this island’!"
Steam (ST): "‘There are at least 19 people on this island’!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): 'There are at least 19 people on this island'!"
PC Japanese (JP): “この島には、１９人以上がいる”！」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「“这岛上的人数，不少于十九人”！」

Umineko Project (UP): At the end of a long, long time spent deliberating, ......letting a single deep breath escape, she quietly proclaimed her refusal.
Steam (ST): At the end of Beato's worrying, ...she took a single deep breath and quietly announced her refusal.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the end, Beato's worries won out. ......Taking a single deep breath, she quietly proclaimed her refusal.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトは悩みに悩みぬいた末。……深いため息をひとつ漏らしながら、静かに拒否を宣言した。
Russian (RU): В конечном итоге верх взяла опасливость Беато. ......Глубоко вздохнув, она тихо объявила о своём отказе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fim de tudo, um longo tempo se passou deliberadamente, ......deixando um único suspiro escapar, ela silenciosamente proclamou sua recusa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵苦思冥想的結果。……是長嘆了一口氣後，靜靜地宣言了拒絕。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵苦思冥想的结果。……是长叹了一口气后，静静地宣言了拒绝。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I had thought that she'd use it.
Steam (ST): ...I thought she'd use it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……使うと思ってた。
Russian (RU): .......Я предполагал, что она воспользуется им.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu pensei que ela tivesse usado isso.
